sentence.Network_en: They ceremoniously cut a piece of ribbon, declaring the exhibition open.
sentence.Network_cn: 他们郑重其事地剪彩，宣布展览开幕。

sentence.Network_en: Chin also came in, and the boys clasped their hands and bowed to her ceremoniously.
sentence.Network_cn: 接着琴从她的房里走出来, 他们也给她作了揖.

entry.def: If someone does something ceremoniously, they do it in an extremely formal way.

example.ex: They ceremoniously cut a piece of ribbon, declaring the exhibition open...
example.tran: 他们郑重其事地剪彩，宣布展览开幕。

auth_sentence.content: Snyder ceremoniously hands me a spoonful of dark-chocolate gelato.
auth_sentence.res_content: Snyder ceremoniously hands me a spoonful of dark-chocolate gelato.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Snyder ceremoniously hands me a spoonful of dark-chocolate gelato.

auth_sentence.content: He once ceremoniously ended a case and started to sum up for the jury before the defence had even begun its arguments.

auth_sentence.res_content_con: He once ceremoniously ended a case and started to sum up for the jury before the defence had even begun its arguments.

auth_sentence.content: The page was blank, and on it, with a fountain pen whose cap he ceremoniously unscrewed, he wrote his name and address.
